Solar panel arrays often can track the sun in-game.

But what about times when you want your ship oriented with the Sun? For example, solar observatories should be facing the Sun at all times. And if your space station has a greenhouse without its own light source, it makes sense to keep the greenhouses facing towards the Sun too.

This might well be what gets me into part development--but I thought I'd throw the request out there and see if there's anything already developed or in the works to address this....

Thanks!
Solar panels are just an animation I believe. Moving the whole craft is another matter. Not to say it can't be done, of course it can tons of mods do it. But it's not just a simple thing.

Isn't it like telling a craft to stay prograde, but instead with the sun as target?

I guess looking at a mod that does this (as example MJ) could be helpful.

seems feasible as a part; not sure about an entire vessel however. it's just a matter of telling the correct transform to orient toward the sun; or to stay in any constant relative orientation toward the sun by offsetting the visible object from the orienting transform. using MJ would require it to continue updating during time warp; I don't know if it does that right now. Advantage of using solar panel module is it will face the Sun no matter what SOI the vessel is in. MJ's orientation hold functions are relative to the SOI; not the Sun.

Does it? back in 23.5 it can hold orientation in Pro/Retrograde; Normal/AntiNorma; and Radial/AntiRadial. facing the sun would only work if you were in a near polar or equatorial orbit; or if the vessel was in the Sun SOI. Maybe that changed. I might take a stab at it soon using the stock SolarPanel module... Solar Panel module only rotates in 1 Axis... would be interesting to see if a nested configuration can do something that orients toward the sun no matter what kind of orbit the vessel is in.

Just remembered the Achilles heel is KSP's joint system. a moving part can't move other parts without IR plugin. With stock modules the best you could do is a single part that orients toward the sun. not an entire vessel or a collection of parts.

What if I modified a probe core with this functionality? Probe cores can use SAS to reorient ships, so it seems to me this proposed part (or maybe ModuleManager config?) would be able to do the same.

nice. I'm behind on all the newer features. as far as adding MJ to parts a simple MM config should work. There was a MM fix that adds MJ to all command pods/probes IIRC. but it's probably a bit dated by now.

If all you want to do is to add the smart sas function, then this should do it:

MODULE
    {
        name = MechJebCore
        MechJebLocalSettings {
            MechJebModuleCustomWindowEditor { unlockTechs = flightControl }
            MechJebModuleSmartASS { unlockTechs = flightControl }
        }
    }

Or for MM it should be something like this:

@PART[SomePart] // change Some PART
{
  MODULE // add a new module to this part
  {
     name = MechJebCore

        MechJebLocalSettings {

            MechJebModuleCustomWindowEditor { unlockTechs = flightControl }

            MechJebModuleSmartASS { unlockTechs = flightControl }

        }
  }
}

Yeah, MJ 2.3 includes the Sun as a reference in Smart ASS's ADV panel:
